sections.markdown:
# Events
##  Davis Problem Events 
* Problem Cards: Monitoring Unavailable, Availablity, Error, Slowdown, Resource, or Custom Events
* Problems Opened, Updated, or Closed
* [Categories of Events](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/event-types)

![](https://mkt-cdn.dynatrace.com/assets/Marketing/illustrations/davis-explained.svg)
## Davis Events
 * Informational events that maybe relevant for root cause analysis or identifying environment changes
 * Framework Changes, Process Crashes, K8s Events, Deployment Events, Annotations
 * [Info Events](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/event-types-info)
 ![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/events.jpg?raw=true)

##  We can also query the SmartScape topology model with DQL!

 ![](https://mkt-cdn.dynatrace.com/assets/Marketing/screenshots/smartscape-service-web-request.png?_ga=2.39254048.2092106028.1702994875-263697944.1702056672&_gac=1.121478266.1702998561.Cj0KCQiAm4WsBhCiARIsAEJIEzX2Jl04XSrkrmt9bcO4tCFI0BRMNM4W2N2LvYiy7L0DBLC-os4jQFoaAmycEALw_wcB&_gl=1*mtlpmg*_ga*MjYzNjk3OTQ0LjE3MDIwNTY2NzI.*_ga_1MEMV02JXV*MTcwMzAxMjE2Ny4yMDkuMS4xNzAzMDEzNjE3LjAuMC4w)

# Exercise 1 - Get familiar with Events
1. Use the FETCH command to query, sort, and limit events
2. Summarize all events by event kind and visualize in a pie chart
3. Summarize Davis Problems by event category

sections.title: Exercise 1.1 - Fetch events, sort, and limit the results

input.value:
fetch events
| sort timestamp desc
| limit 100

1. Get familiar with the service entity table
2. Get familiar with the host entity table and runs command
3. Expand on runs
4. Show and expand tags on a host

input.value: fetch dt.entity.service

sections.markdown:
# Exercise 3 - Find the most problematic services
1. For the Davis Problems, expand the array of affected entity ids
2. Filter only on problems have services in the affected entity ids
3. Use the expanded affected entity ids to lookup the service name in the entity table (hint: look at the lookup function documentation) 
4. Display the top 10 "most problematic" services by name and count of distinct problem display id in a categorical chart. Sort count descending.

sections.title: Exercise 3.1 - Fetch events that are Davis Problems, expand the affected entity IDs field, and return only category, name, and affected entity IDs

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| fields timestamp, event.category, event.name, affected_entity_ids

sections.title: Exercise 3.2 - Filter only on problems have services in the affected entity ids

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
| fields timestamp, event.category, event.name, affected_entity_ids

sections.title: Exercise 3.3 - After expanding, use lookup to get the Service name that was affected by the event

input.value:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
//lookup the service name ("join") - use affected_entity_id has sourceField and lookup the id in the entity table to grab the name
| lookup [fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
  | fields entity.name, id], sourceField:affected_entity_ids,lookupField:id
//optionally choose the fields to return
| fields event.category, event.name, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids, timestamp

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
| lookup 
	[
		fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
		| fields entity.name, id
	], sourceField:affected_entity_ids, lookupField:id
| fields event.category, event.name, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids, timestamp
grail.query:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
//lookup the service name ("join") - use affected_entity_id has sourceField and lookup the id in the entity table to grab the name
| lookup [fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
  | fields entity.name, id], sourceField:affected_entity_ids,lookupField:id
//optionally choose the fields to return
| fields event.category, event.name, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids, timestamp

//lookup the service name ("join") - use affected_entity_id has sourceField and lookup the id in the entity table to grab the name
| lookup [fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
  | fields entity.name, id], sourceField:affected_entity_ids,lookupField:id
//optionally choose the fields to return
| fields event.category, event.name, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids, timestamp

sections.title: Exercise 3.4 - Display the top 10 "most problematic" services by name and count of distinct problem display id

input.value:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
| summarize by:{affected_entity_ids}, count = countDistinct(display_id)

| lookup [fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
  | fields entity.name, id], sourceField:affected_entity_ids,lookupField:id

| fields count, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids
| sort count, direction:"descending"
| limit 10

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| expand affected_entity_ids
| filter matchesPhrase(affected_entity_ids, "CLOUD")
| summarize by:{affected_entity_ids}, count = countDistinct(display_id)
| lookup 
	[
		fetch dt.entity.cloud_application
		| fields entity.name, id
	], sourceField:affected_entity_ids, lookupField:id
| fields count, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids
| sort count desc
| limit 10

| fields count, lookup.entity.name, affected_entity_ids
| sort count, direction:"descending"
| limit 10

sections.markdown:
# Exercise 4 - Time to Restore Service (MTTR)
1. Fetch Davis Problems that had a resolved problem duration (not null), were closed, and with severity of Error
2. Summarize the average problem duration in milliseconds
3. Create a new field for average problem duration in minutes

sections.title: Exercise 4.1 - Fetch Events (Davis Problems), where the resolved_problem_duration is populated, the event status is closed, and a category of Error

input.value:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| filter isNotNull(resolved_problem_duration)
| filter event.status == "CLOSED"
| filter event.category == "ERROR"

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| filter isNotNull(resolved_problem_duration)
| filter event.status == "CLOSED"
| filter event.category == "ERROR"

sections.title: Exercise 4.2 - Summarize the records according to the average resolved problem duration. This needs to make use of a certain aggregation function, and ensure the average duration result is in milliseconds.

input.value:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| filter isNotNull(resolved_problem_duration)
| filter event.status == "CLOSED"
| filter event.category == "ERROR"

| summarize avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration)), by:{display_id, affected_entity_ids}
| summarize average_problem_duration_env_ms = avg(`avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration))`), by:{display_id, affected_entity_ids}

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| filter isNotNull(resolved_problem_duration)
| filter event.status == "CLOSED"
| filter event.category == "ERROR"
| summarize by:{display_id, affected_entity_ids}, avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration))
| summarize by:{display_id, affected_entity_ids}, average_problem_duration_env_ms = avg(`avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration))`)

sections.title: Summarize 4.3 - Add a field to convert the field from the previous exercise from ms to minutes, and return only the final field.

input.value:
fetch events
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| filter isNotNull(resolved_problem_duration)
| filter event.status == "CLOSED"
| filter event.category == "ERROR"

| summarize avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration)), by:{display_id, affected_entity_ids}
| summarize average_problem_duration_env_ms = avg(`avg(toLong(resolved_problem_duration))`)

//when using single value display chart, divide by 60,000,000,000 since DT gives it in nanoseconds
| fieldsAdd average_problem_duration_env_minutes = (average_problem_duration_env_ms) / 60000000000
| fields average_problem_duration_env_minutes
